qas.question: Along with West, Downtown and North, what is the other notable area of Miami?
By cardinal direction, what part of the city is referred to as Downtown?
Along with Port Miami, Watson Island and Brickell, what area is in Downtown Miami?
On what street is the highest concentration of international banks in the US?
Where is South Beach in relation to Downtown?
Along with West, Downtown and North, what is the other unnotable area of Miami?
By cardinal direction, what part of the city isn't referred to as Downtown?
Along with Port Miami, Watson Island and Brickell, what area isn't in Downtown Miami?
On what street is the lowest concentration of international banks in the US?
Where is South Beach in relation to Uptown?

context: Miami is partitioned into many different sections, roughly into North, <a0_0><b5_0>South<b5_0/><a0_0/>, West and Downtown. The heart of the city is Downtown Miami and is technically on the <a1_0><b6_0>eastern<b6_0/><a1_0/> side of the city. This area includes Brickell, <a2_0><b7_0>Virginia Key<b7_0/><a2_0/>, Watson Island, and PortMiami. Downtown is South Florida's central business district, and Florida's largest and most influential central business district. Downtown has the largest concentration of international banks in the U.S. along <a3_0><b8_0>Brickell Avenue<b8_0/><a3_0/>. Downtown is home to many major banks, courthouses, financial headquarters, cultural and tourist attractions, schools, parks and a large residential population. <a4_0><b9_0>East<b9_0/><a4_0/> of Downtown, across Biscayne Bay is South Beach. Just northwest of Downtown, is the Civic Center, which is Miami's center for hospitals, research institutes and biotechnology with hospitals such as Jackson Memorial Hospital, Miami VA Hospital, and the University of Miami's Leonard M. Miller School of Medicine.
